protocol_name: Inoculation of Holidic Media (HM) with bacteria to generate gnotobiotic Drosophila
protocol_name_html: Inoculation of Holidic Media (HM) with bacteria to generate gnotobiotic Drosophila
description:
This protocol is part of the manuscript: Gonçalves et al. Commensal bacteria and essential amino acids control food choice behavior and reproduction. Plos Biology. 2017 Apr 18.

 

We thank the Leulier laboratory for their help in establishing this protocol.
protocol_affiliation: Champalimaud Centre for the Unknown, School of Biological Sciences
manuscript_citation: Leitão-Gonçalves R, Carvalho-Santos Z, Francisco AP, Fioreze GT, Anjos M, Baltazar C, Elias AP, Itskov PM, Piper MDW, Ribeiro C, Commensal bacteria and essential amino acids control food choice behavior and reproduction. PLoS Biology 15(4). doi: 10.1371/journal.pbio.2000862
keywords: Drosophila, holidic medium, axenic, gnotobiotic, feeding behavior, feeding decisions, microbiota, diet, nutrients

components.data: Prepare 1:10 dilutions of each bacterial liquid culture using the corresponding media to do the dilutions. Measure the OD at 600nm using a spectrophotometer and using the corresponding media as a blank.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare 1:10 dilutions of each bacterial liquid culture using the corresponding media to do the dilutions. Measure the OD at 600nm using a spectrophotometer and using the corresponding media as a blank.

components.data: Bacterial cultures preparation
components.name: Section

components.data:
For each HM vial you will need the following volume of the liquid culture:

 

  • 0.025 ml of L. plantarumWJL culture
  • 0.002 ml of L. brevisEW culture
  • 0.1 ml of C. intestiniA911T culture
  • 0.2 ml of A. pomorum culture
  • 0.2 ml of E. faecalis culture

 

Calculate the total volume of each culture required for your experiment by multiplying these volumes by the total number of vials being inoculated.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
For each HM vial you will need the following volume of the liquid culture:

 

  • 0.025 ml of L. plantarumWJL culture
  • 0.002 ml of L. brevisEW culture
  • 0.1 ml of C. intestiniA911T culture
  • 0.2 ml of A. pomorum culture
  • 0.2 ml of E. faecalis culture

 

Calculate the total volume of each culture required for your experiment by multiplying these volumes by the total number of vials being inoculated.

components.data: Calculating the volume of bacterial culture required
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Calculating the volume of bacterial culture required

components.data: Once the total volume of each bacterial culture is known, pipette them into a falcon to obtain the required combinations.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Once the total volume of each bacterial culture is known, pipette them into a falcon to obtain the required combinations.

components.data: Preparation of the bacterial mix
components.name: Section

components.data: To exclude an effect of residual components of the bacterial media on the experiments, pipette the equivalent volume of the different sterile bacterial media and use them as a control.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To exclude an effect of residual components of the bacterial media on the experiments, pipette the equivalent volume of the different sterile bacterial media and use them as a control.

components.data: Preparation of the bacterial mix
components.name: Section

components.data: Centrifuge the bacterial mixes and controls at 3000 rpm in an Eppendorf 5810R centrifuge for 10 min at room temperature, remove the supernatant, and re-suspend the pellet in 1x sterile PBS.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the bacterial mixes and controls at 3000 rpm in an Eppendorf 5810R centrifuge for 10 min at room temperature, remove the supernatant, and re-suspend the pellet in 1x sterile PBS.

components.data: Preparation of the bacterial mix
components.name: Section

components.data: Repeat step 8 twice.
components.name: Description

components.data: Preparation of the bacterial mix
components.name: Section

components.data: After the final centrifugation, discard all the supernatant from the control and the bacterial mixes and re-suspend the pellets in sufficient 1x sterile PBS to obtain a final inoculation volume of 50 µl per vial. Mix by gently pipetting up and down.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After the final centrifugation, discard all the supernatant from the control and the bacterial mixes and re-suspend the pellets in sufficient 1x sterile PBS to obtain a final inoculation volume of 50 µl per vial. Mix by gently pipetting up and down.

components.data: Preparation of the bacterial mix
components.name: Section

components.data: Add the final suspensions of control and bacteria mixes to the surface of the HM (50 µl per tube) and allow it to dry for approximately 1 h before adding the flies.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add the final suspensions of control and bacteria mixes to the surface of the HM (50 µl per tube) and allow it to dry for approximately 1 h before adding the flies.

components.data: Inoculation of bacterial mixes in HM
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Inoculation of bacterial mixes in HM

components.data: For the experiments with heat-inactivated bacteria: incubate the bacterial mix at 100°C in a dry bath for 10 min before inoculating the HM vials.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: For the experiments with heat-inactivated bacteria: incubate the bacterial mix at 100°C in a dry bath for 10 min before inoculating the HM vials.

components.data: Preparation of the bacterial mix
components.name: Section

components.data: Prepare the HM needed for the experiment following the steps in the Holidic Media (HM) preparation protocol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare the HM needed for the experiment following the steps in the Holidic Media (HM) preparation protocol.

components.data: Grow the bacterial cultures in liquid media according to the Growing Drosophila gut bacteria protocol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Grow the bacterial cultures in liquid media according to the Growing Drosophila gut bacteria protocol.

components.data: Bacterial cultures preparation
components.name: Section

components.data:
Allow the bacterial cultures to grow until they reach approximatly the following ODs:

 

  • OD L. plantarumWJL=6
  • OD L. brevisEW=8
  • OD C. intestiniA911T=1.5
  • OD A. pomorum=0.7
  • OD E. faecalis=0.8
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Allow the bacterial cultures to grow until they reach approximatly the following ODs:

 

  • OD L. plantarumWJL=6
  • OD L. brevisEW=8
  • OD C. intestiniA911T=1.5
  • OD A. pomorum=0.7
  • OD E. faecalis=0.8

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 4 of Inoculation of Holidic Media (HM) with bacteria to generate gnotobiotic Drosophila
source_data.protocol_name: Inoculation of Holidic Media (HM) with bacteria to generate gnotobiotic Drosophila
source_data.protocol_name_html: Inoculation of Holidic Media (HM) with bacteria to generate gnotobiotic Drosophila
source_data.annotation: If these ODs are much higher than the reference values, a contamination likely occured. If they are much lower, it is likely to mean that the bacteria are no longer healthy. In these cases we advise you to start a new solid culture from the frozen bacterial stock.
source_data.thread_text: If these ODs are much higher than the reference values, a contamination likely occured. If they are much lower, it is likely to mean that the bacteria are no longer healthy. In these cases we advise you to start a new solid culture from the frozen bacterial stock.
source_data.body: If these ODs are much higher than the reference values, a contamination likely occured. If they are much lower, it is likely to mean that the bacteria are no longer healthy. In these cases we advise you to start a new solid culture from the frozen bacterial stock.
